definition: to make a wild guess/blind guess

sentences.english: However, avoid wild guessing – especially if marks are taken off for wrong answers.
sentences.chinese: 但是要避免瞎猜，特別是如果答錯要扣分的話。

sentences.english: The ones who are left now are just guessing.
sentences.chinese: 剩下來的人就只能瞎猜了。

sentences.english: Here's a guy who thinks young, I figure.
sentences.chinese: 眼前的這個傢伙就人老心不老，我瞎猜的。

sentences.english: The whole thing left the audience wondering;
sentences.chinese: 這整個事情都讓觀衆瞎猜。

sentences.english: Both teams made some wild guesses at the race result, none of which were right.
sentences.chinese: 兩個隊對比賽結果都瞎猜一通，沒有一個猜對。

sentences.english: Moreover, it's a lot better than the greater amount of guesswork that went into earlier calculations.
sentences.chinese: 此外，這比早期計算的大量瞎猜工作已經好多了。

definition: to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to imagine that one's love is reciprocated/to shower affection on an uninterested party
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
